easy.title: Novak Djokovic's Tennis Plans
easy.summary: Novak Djokovic is a famous tennis player who has decided not to play in an important tournament in Paris. He didn't say exactly why he's not playing, which makes people wonder about his plans for the rest of the tennis season. Djokovic is 38 years old and has been having some injury problems recently. He had to stop playing in two different matches because of his body. Even though he's played in only 12 tournaments this year, he's still one of the top three players in the world. Djokovic has won the Paris tournament seven times before, so it's surprising he's not going this time. He says he wants to focus on making more tennis history. Next, he plans to play in a smaller tournament in Athens that his family helps run, and then the big season-ending tournament in Italy.

middle.title: Djokovic's Strategic Season Planning
middle.summary: Novak Djokovic's unexpected withdrawal from the Paris Masters raises significant questions about his approach to the remainder of the tennis season. The 38-year-old Serbian champion, who has dominated men's tennis for over a decade, made the announcement via social media without providing specific reasons for his decision. This comes after recent physical struggles, including an injury-hampered performance at the Shanghai Masters where he lost to qualifier Valentin Vacherot in the semi-finals, and having to retire from his exhibition match against Taylor Fritz in Saudi Arabia. Despite competing in only 12 tournaments this season, Djokovic maintains his position as the third-ranked player in the ATP race, behind Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner. His immediate focus shifts to the ATP 250 event in Athens, a tournament owned by his family that holds emotional significance. Following that, he's qualified for the season-ending ATP Finals in Turin. Djokovic's selective tournament participation reflects his stated priority of creating further tennis history rather than accumulating ranking points. His withdrawal from a tournament he has won seven times suggests a calculated approach to managing his physical condition while pursuing legacy-defining achievements in the latter stages of his career.

high.title: Djokovic's Calculated Career Management in Professional Tennis
high.summary: Novak Djokovic's decision to withdraw from the Paris Masters represents a significant development in the strategic management of his professional tennis career during its latter stages. The 38-year-old Serbian, holder of 24 Grand Slam titles, announced his withdrawal without providing explicit reasoning, creating speculation about his physical condition and competitive priorities. This decision follows concerning performances, including an injury-compromised semi-final loss to qualifier Valentin Vacherot at the Shanghai Masters and a retirement from his exhibition match against Taylor Fritz at the Six Kings Slam in Saudi Arabia. Despite participating in merely 12 tournaments throughout the 2023 season, Djokovic maintains an impressive third-place position in the ATP race standings, trailing only Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner. His immediate competitive focus shifts to the ATP 250 event in Athens, a tournament with familial connections as it is owned by his family and was relocated from Belgrade, suggesting personal significance beyond mere ranking considerations. Subsequently, he has qualified for the prestigious ATP Finals in Turin. Djokovic's selective approach to tournament participation reflects his repeatedly stated objective of creating additional tennis history rather than accumulating ranking points or appearance fees. The withdrawal from an event he has dominated with seven previous victories indicates a sophisticated calculation balancing physical preservation, legacy objectives, and strategic preparation for the most significant remaining competitions in the professional tennis calendar.

zh.title: 德约科维奇退出巴黎大师赛后的网球生涯规划
zh.summary: 诺瓦克·德约科维奇突然退出即将举行的巴黎大师赛，且未明确说明原因，这引发了对他本赛季剩余时间计划的诸多疑问。这位38岁的塞尔维亚网球名将近期身体状况令人担忧，在上海大师赛半决赛中因伤负于资格赛选手瓦舍罗，随后又在沙特阿拉伯的六王表演赛中因伤退赛。尽管本赛季仅参加了12项赛事，德约科维奇依然在ATP冠军积分榜上位列第三，仅次于阿尔卡拉斯和辛纳。他通过社交媒体宣布退出巴黎大师赛的决定，这个他曾七次夺冠的赛事。德约科维奇接下来的重点将是雅典ATP250赛事——这项由其家族拥有并从贝尔格莱德迁址的赛事具有特殊情感意义。随后他将参加在都灵举行的赛季收官战ATP总决赛。德约科维奇的选择性参赛策略反映了他反复强调的当前优先事项：创造更多网球历史而非积累积分。从他已经七次夺冠的赛事中退赛，表明这位老将在职业生涯后期正在采取精明的策略，平衡身体状况管理、历史遗产追求和重要赛事备战之间的关系。
